subject: Re: [junit] Dependencies between test-methods
msgSnippet: ... For unit tests, yes.  For integration/functional tests, it s pretty common. Stefan, for what it s worth, TestNG lets you specify such dependencies, e.g.
messageBody:
On Wed, Mar 12, 2008 at 12:52 AM, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:

> In my not so humble opinion, a complex method is a serious design smell

For unit tests, yes. For integration/functional tests, it's pretty common.

Stefan, for what it's worth, TestNG lets you specify such dependencies, e.g.

@Test
public void startApplicationServer() { ... }

@Test(dependsOnMethods = { "startApplicationServer"})
public void sendToServlet() { ... }

If startApplicationServer() fails, sendToServlet() will not be run and
marked as a SKIP. You can also specify these dependencies on entire
groups of methods (less fragile than the code above).

> So I'd rather change the design so that it's not so complex anymore

Don't we all/? :-)

--
Cédric
